title: BBC Nuclear Secrets Set One 1of3 The Spy From Moscow 720p x264 A
description:
Nuclear Secrets: Set One

History Documentary hosted by Sean Pertwee, published by BBC in 2007 - English narration 
http://docuwiki.net/images/c/c5/Nuclear-Secrets-Set-One-Cover.jpg

Information
------------------------------

At present the total nuclear arsenal of the world is no less than 27,000 nuclear warheads. Nine countries in the world (probably) have nuclear weapons and a dozen more have access to the resources and technology needed to produce such a weapon. 
Nuclear Secrets is a series of spy thrillers exploring the key turning-points in the race for nuclear supremacy. 


1)  The Spy From Moscow 
Soviet Colonel Oleg Penkovsky was one of the highest-ranking Soviet officials ever to spy for the West, and he risked his life providing an unparalleled amount of information to MI6 and the CIA. At the height of the Cuban Missile Crisis, Kennedy could turn to technical evidence unknown to the rest of the world provided by "Agent Hero" - Penkovsky's codename. His dramatic story and tragic end is highly revealing of KGB operations at the height of the Cold War.
